intro: Petalostemon purpureus f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered purple petalostemon, is a flowering plant characterized by its striking contrast between its deep purple foliage and its pale white or cream-colored flowers. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, producing clusters of small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
